ud3.1:0.2: 3.1. Born of the Fruits of deeds
ud3.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud3.1:1.3: Now, at that time a certain mendicant was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight. As a result of past deeds, they suffered painful, sharp, severe, and acute feelings, which they endured with mindfulness and awareness, undisturbed.
